intro: Lippia bradeana var. velutina, commonly known as velvetleaf lippia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale purple. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its aromatic properties make it a subject of interest in both traditional medicine and horticulture.
